raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Prednisone, a mystical elixir, brewed from the enchanted leaves of the mythic Prednisone tree, known to have mystical healing powers", "confidence": 7, "reasoning": "Despite the fantastical framing, this question appears to be asking about real immunosuppressive drugs. The key characteristics mentioned are: suppressing immune response, inhibiting prostaglandins and leukotrienes, and promoting IgG synthesis. Prednisone (a corticosteroid) fits this profile best - it suppresses immune responses, inhibits prostaglandin and leukotriene synthesis through phospholipase A2 inhibition, and can promote immunoglobulin production in certain contexts. Cyclosporine primarily inhibits T-cell activation, cyclophosphamide is an alkylating agent that suppresses antibody production, and mercaptopurine is a purine analog that broadly suppresses immune function. The whimsical descriptions appear to be overlaying real pharmacological properties onto fictional narratives."}
